abstract.text: Requests the largest represented image as data bytes and EXIF orientation for the specified asset.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The asset for which to load image data.
Options specifying how Photos should handle the request, format the requested image, and notify your app of progress or errors.
If
is requested and the asset has adjustments, the largest rendered image data is returned. In all other cases, the original image data is returned.
For further details, see
A block called, exactly once, when image loading is complete, providing the requested image or information about the status of the request.
The block takes the following parameters:
The requested image.
imageData
The uniform type identifier for the image.
dataUTI
The EXIF orientation for the image, as a
. For iOS or tvOS, convert this orientation to a
orientation
A dictionary providing information about the status of the request. See
for possible keys and values.
info
A numeric identifier for the request. If you need to cancel the request before it completes, pass this identifier to the
method.
When you call this method, Photos loads the largest available representation of the image asset, then calls your
block to provide the requested data. Depending on the options you specify and the current state of the asset, Photos may download asset data from the network.
By default, this method executes asynchronously. If you call it from a background thread, you may change the
property of the
parameter to
to block the calling thread until either the requested image is ready or an error occurs, at which time Photos calls your result handler. This method ignores the
option—Photos calls your result handler block exactly once.
If the
option is set to
, Photos provides rendered image data, including the results of any edits that have been made to the asset content. Otherwise, Photos provides the originally captured image data for the asset.

abstract.text: A value describing the intended display orientation for an image.
Constants that specify the intended display orientation for an image.
Keys identifying information about an image loading result, used in the
block with image request methods.
Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
A representation of an image, video, or Live Photo in the Photos library.
An object that facilitates retrieving or generating preview thumbnails and asset data.
Cancels an asynchronous request
Requests an image representation for the specified asset.
Requests the largest represented image as data bytes and EXIF orientation for the specified asset.
Requests full-sized image data for the specified asset.
A special value for requesting original image data or the largest rendered image available. .
A numeric identifier for an asynchronous image request.
A set of options affecting the delivery of still image representations of Photos assets you request from an image manager.
The requested image quality and delivery priority.
A Boolean value that determines whether Photos processes the image request synchronously.
The version of the image to be requested.
Request the most recent version of the image asset (the one that reflects all edits).
A value describing the intended display orientation for an image.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object representing a static collection of key-value pairs, for use instead of a  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A byte buffer in memory.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A type-erased hashable value.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
